FOOD PRODUCTION SCHEMES, IRELAND.
MEMORANDUM PREPARED IN COMPLIANCE WITH CHIEF SECRETARY'S MINUTE OF 17TH MARCH, 1917.
Week ended 22nd May, 1918.
The following is a brief statement on the work of the Department during the past week in furtherance of increased Food Production in Ireland:-
LOANS FOR AGRICULTURAL IMPLEMENTS.
Twenty applications for loans for agricultural implements were received by the Department during the past week. The total value of machinery ordered from the beginning of the present year to date, under the Scheme, amounts to Â£32,374.
ARTIFICIAL MANURES.
The Department are at present making arrangements for the supply and distribution of artificial manures for next year. Special provision is being made for the import into Ireland of the available supplies of Basic Slag and Sulphate of Ammonia and of raw materials for the manufacture of Superphosphate. The prices of all artificial fertilisers for next season have now been fixed under an Order of the Ministry of Munitions.
POTATO SPRAYING.
Preparations for the coming season's potato spraying campaign are in active progress throughout the country
